member.name: T:BasicxLogger.ILogger
member.summary: Interface for BasicxLogger

member.name: P:BasicxLogger.ILogger.messageFormat
member.summary: Contains all informations about the formatting of the log messages

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.log(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given message and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.log(BasicxLogger.Message.Tag,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the given message with the given tag and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.logID(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the given message, a message ID and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

Set to true if you want to make sure the message id is unique. If set to true, the loging of the message may take longer an use more ram depending on how big your log file is. When the log file exceeds the length of 1,073,741,823 chars (a little over 1GB file size) the ID will not be verifyed.
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.logID(BasicxLogger.Message.Tag,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the given message with the given tag, a message ID and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

Set to true if you want to make sure the message id is unique. If set to true, the loging of the message may take longer an use more ram depending on how big your log file is. When the log file exceeds the length of 1,073,741,823 chars (a little over 1GB file size) the ID will not be verifyed.
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.logAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronous writes the given message and the current time stamp to the log file.
member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file

member.remarks: If the log file and/or directory is missing, the method will automatically create them.
member.param: The message that will be writen to the file
A Tag that will be added to the message, to make it easy to distinguish between differen log messages

member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.ILogger.logIDAsync(BasicxLogger.Message.Tag,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Asynchronous writes the given message with the given tag, a message ID and the current time stamp to the log file.

Set to true if you want to make sure the message id is unique. If set to true, the loging of the message may take longer an use more ram depending on how big your log file is. When the log file exceeds the length of 1,073,741,823 chars (a little over 1GB file size) the ID will not be verifyed.
member.returns: The message ID that was automatically assigned to the message. It can be used to identify a specific message.

member.name: M:BasicxLogger.Logger.deleteLogFile
member.summary: Deletes the log file, that was created by the logger.
member.remarks: All logs will be lost. If you log again after deleting the log file, the logger will create a new file.
